submission:
class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:
        res = 0
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse = True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse = True)
        i = j = 0
        v_count = h_count = 1

        while i<len(horizontalCut) and j<len(verticalCut):
            if verticalCut[j]>=horizontalCut[i]:
                res+=verticalCut[j]*h_count
                v_count+=1
                # print('vertical ', res, count)
                j+=1
            else:
                res+=horizontalCut[i]*v_count
                h_count+=1
                i+=1
                # print('horizontal ', res, count)
        
        while i<len(horizontalCut):
            res+=horizontalCut[i]*v_count
            h_count+=1
            i+=1
            # print('horizontal ', res, count)

        while j<len(verticalCut):
            res+=verticalCut[j]*h_count
            v_count+=1
            # print('vertical ', res, count)
            j+=1
        
        return res
